attributes.action: force Ofcom to introduce and enforce a simple numbering range where the cost of the call is the same no matter which landline or mobile provider is used. i.e. 0810 is a fixed 10p call, 0820 is fixed 20p call
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: "Calls from mobiles may be considerably higher" is not a very clear indication of the cost of the call.  Wouldn't it be better/easier for some services to be advertised as "...will cost you 10p from any UK telephone" - Oh yeah, and link the number to the price of the call so that the last two digits of the prefix indicate the price in pence of the call - 0825 as an example will cost 25p

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
